template.name: Robot

transition.label: ND[id] == R
done[id] = true, allDone = count(done) == R ? 1 : 0, sameCycle = allSameTimestamp(cycle)
These updates are only for verification (SMC)
mayContinue && ND[id] != R
updateP(), decision[id] = maxIndex(P), resetD(), level[id] = 1, mayContinue = false
calm[id] == 3
ND[id] = count(D[id]), publicP[id] = P, mayContinue = false, incrementCycle()

query.comment:
How many cycles in total does robot 0 go through before consensus is reached.
Results: For 7 robots with random preferences in a fully connected graphs. [<=1000;5000] ≈ 2 (as expected)

plot.title: Probability Density Distribution
plot.comment: Parameters: α=0.05, ε=0.05, bucket width=3, bucket count=11 Runs: 100 in total, 100 (100%) displayed, 0 (0%) remaining Span of displayed sample: [3, 34] Mean estimate of displayed sample: 15.19 ± 2.038 (95% CI)

query.comment: It would be nice to have the reverse query. Within this time, how much time does it take at most to reach this state? There should be a few edge cases where a robot takes one more cycle than the others. This is because of unknown interleavings that causes a single robot (seemingly a robot with only one neighbor) to not calculate their decision group size correctly at the first cycle where all robots agree.
